Question
========
Which are good practice habits when using probability in ecology? Select all that apply.

Answerlist
----------
* Define events clearly before calculating probabilities
* Avoid assuming independence without justification
* Use complements/unions to avoid double-counting
* Assume everything is independent to simplify

Solution
========
Good practice is conceptual: define events, choose the correct rule, and justify assumptions. Unjustified independence can badly mislead inference.
